column4: if I want my "deploy" user to be able to run a2ensite and a2dissite without entering a password for sudo
how would that line look in visudo (aka /etc/sudoers)
what would be the proper syntax for a line in /etc/sudoers to allow a given user to run a given command without requiring the password
like if I want my deploy user to be able to run a2ensite without needing a password
I believe the NOPASSWD tag is what you're looking for
right but where does that go?
Given that I know you're competent, I have to say RTFM :P
by the way, adding a user to the "sudo" group on Debian-based systems will, as I understand it, globally exempt them from password requirements.
um, no that just allows you to run sudo commands
it doesn't exempt you from needing a password
I don't believe so. The exempt_group setting in the sudoers file is set to sudo on Debian systems.
Similarly, I'm able to sudo, but I'm not in the sudo group.
so "if you have exempt_group" or some such, yes probably what you said is true
